intro: Halosarcia flabelliformis, commonly known as the fan-shaped sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid and saline environments. Halosarcia flabelliformis is often found growing in dune ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
